question:
Reign: 1894-1917
Notes: Last Russian emperor, Romanov (304 year dynasty), autocratic, lost Russo-Japanese War and WWI, known as Saint <name> the Passion-Bearer, abdicated in 1917

Reign: 1917
Notes: First prime minister of republican Russia, last Muscovite and Rurikid head of Russian state, organized relief work in the Russian Far East during the Russo-Japanese War

Reign: 1917
Notes: Lawyer/revolutionary, lead the Russian Provisional Government, continued WWI involvement (unpopular), Marxist/Bolshevik October Revolution lead Lenin to power and his exile

Reign: 1917-1924
Notes: Marxist/Bolshevik, first head of government of Communist Soviet Russia and the Soviet Union, defeated anti-Bolsheviks in Russian Civil War, succeeded by Stalin in death

Reign: 1924-1953
Notes: Marxist/Leninist, became dicator in the 1930s, Five-Year Plans, industrialization, Great Purge (Gulags), anti-fascist, Soviet Red Army (WWII), entered Cold War with the US, succeeded by Khrushchev in death

Reign: 1953-1964
Notes: Denounced Stalin, Soviet space program (Sputnik), Cuban Missile Crisis, Suez Crisis, U-2 Incident (1960), reduced Cold War tensions, stripped of power by the Kremlin - succeeded by Brezhnev

Reign: 1964-1982
Notes: Conservative/pragmatic approach, economic stagnation, achieved nuclear parity with the US, strengthened influence in Central/Eastern Europe + Africa + the Middle East, succeeded in death by Andropov

Reign: 1982-1984
Notes: Took over governing when Brezhnev grew ill in 1975, Cold War intensified, brought up new energetic reformers, succeeded in death by Chernenko

Reign: 1984-1985
Notes: Previously held propaganda roles and set policy of the Politburo (USSR policy-making agency), failing health most of his term, succeeded in death by Gorbachev

Reign: 1985-1991
Notes: Last USSR leader, more socially democratic, withdrew troops in Soviet-Afghan War, restricted nuclear weapons with Reagan, glasnost (openness), perestroika (restructuring), Berlin Wall fell (1989), August Coup unsuccessful - USSR dissolved, he resigned

Reign: 1991-1999
Notes: First president of Russian Federation, instrumental in USSR dissolution, reforms - representative democracy, generally more free, succeeded by his chosen successor - Putin

Reign: 1999-2008, 2012-Present
Notes: Shifted Russia back to authoritarianism, Chechen War, annexation of Crimea, War in Ukraine, endemic corruption, human rights violations, suppressed opponents/media/fair elections, economy - oil and gas

Reign: 2008-2012
Notes: President between Putin's terms, more liberal than Putin, attempted to modernize economy away from oil/gas, Russo-Georgian War victory, recovered from Great Recession, resigned government in 2020 for Putin's constitutional changes
